Package models

Class GameState.Patch

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.GameState.Patch
  • Enclosing class:
    GameState
    public class GameState.Patch
extends java.lang.Object
    Describes an atomic update to the game state. Unchanged fields are left as null. Objects of this type are emitted to subscribers.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

    • Field Detail

      • currentPlayer

        protected Player currentPlayer
        The player who's turn it is.

      • players

        protected org.javatuples.Pair<Player,​Player> players
        The players in this game.

      • move

        protected org.javatuples.Triplet<Player,​java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> move
        A tuple describing a player's move. The first index is a Player object describing the player who made the move. The second and third indices are the x- and y-coordinates (respectively) of the grid cell they played to.

      • status

        protected GameState.Status status
        The game's current status.

      • winner

        protected Player winner
        The winner of the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Patch

        public Patch()

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        The player whose turn it is. Not defined for games with a status other than Status.NEW or Status.IN_PROGRESS.
        Returns:
        The current player, or null if the current player has not changed since the last patch.

      • getPlayers

        public org.javatuples.Pair<Player,​Player> getPlayers()
        The players who are playing this game. Not defined for games with a status other than Status.NEW or Status.IN_PROGRESS.
        Returns:
        The players in this game, or null if the current players have not changed since the last patch.

      • getMove

        public org.javatuples.Triplet<Player,​java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> getMove()
        Describes a player move onto the board, or null if no move.
        Returns:
        The first index is a Player object describing the player who made the move. The second and third indices are the x- and y-coordinates (respectively) of the grid cell they played to. Returns null if no move has been played since the last patch.

      • getStatus

        public GameState.Status getStatus()
        Returns the game's current status.
        Returns:
        The game's current status. Returns null if the status is unchanged since the last patch.

      • getWinner

        public Player getWinner()
        Returns the winner of the game.
        Returns:
        The winner of the game. Will return null if the winner has not changed since the last patch, or if the winner has been revoked.
